data_table.description: Airway Measurements Based on CT Lung Images (CT Round 2), Offspring, Generation 3, Omni 1, and Omni 2, 2008-2011. A subset of the Offspring and Generation 3 cohorts underwent gated whole lung CT imaging with the primary goal of assessing coronary artery calcification.

variable.name: IDTYPE
variable.comment: IDTYPE and ID taken together form a unique study participant identification number.

variable.name: Lobe
variable.description: RUL is the right upper lobe and RLL is the right lower lobe

variable.name: Generation
variable.description: 3rd generation airways: segmental airways 4th generation airways: subsegmental airways

variable.name: outerRadius
variable.comment: It is the mean distance from the centroid of the lumen to the outer surface of the airway wall.

variable.name: outerArea
variable.description: Total cross sectional area of the bronchus

variable.name: WallAreaFraction
variable.description: Ratio of the wall area to total bronchial area of the bronchus

variable.name: WallAreaPCT
variable.description: 100 * the ratio of the wall area to total bronchial area of the bronchus

variable.name: PeakWallIntensity
variable.description: Measure of the mean of the peak attenuation values (HU) within the airway wall
variable.comment: The centroid of the airway lumen is identified and from that point 256 rays are cast out through the airway wall into the lung parenchyma (like spokes on a wheel). The inner and outer boundary of the airway wall is then identified along each ray or "spoke" and the value of the pixel with the peak CT attenuation within the airway wall is recorded. The PeakWallIntensity is the mean of 256 attenuation values collected for each airway of interest.

variable.name: Power
variable.comment: Experimental measure of mural mass obtained by calculating the area under the curve (i.e. the plot of attenuation versus distance along the ray between inner and outer wall) for each of the 256 rays described above in PeakWallIntensity. The area under the curve is thought to be relatively invariate by scanner and provides an estimate of mass. Power is expressed as the average of the area under the curve for the 256 rays in each airway of interest.
